New Records: Lautaro Martínez now has nine goals in Copa América and has scored in his last four games for Argentina.
Key Match Events: Lautaro Martínez scored twice in the second half to help Argentina's second string beat Peru 2-0 at the Copa América on Saturday.
Argentina were awarded a penalty for handball in the 72nd minute, but Leandro Paredes smashed his spot-kick off the post.
Pre-Game Insights: Argentina had already qualified for the quarter-finals before the match in Miami with wins over Canada and Chile.
Messi, who celebrated his 37th birthday on Monday, is recovering from a thigh injury he picked up during their win over Chile on Tuesday.
Post-Match Reflections: Lautaro Martínez told TyC Sports, 'I'm happy, because I was able to score in the three group-stage games and because I was able to help the team, which is what counts.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina dominated possession in the first half and had three attempts on target.
Peru's goalkeeper Gallese kept the scoreline respectable with a string of saves.
Others: The match was played at the Hard Rock Stadium in Miami Gardens, Florida, USA, with an attendance of 64,972.
